summary.p: The Civatarumōttaram, also entitled Civatarumōttirakāviyam in the present manuscript, text with commentary, complete in 12 chapters, and followed by satellite stanzas (various stutis, praises).

The bundle contains:
An additional title page (U1).
Invocation and preface (U2a + U2b).
The text, complete in 12 chapters, and its commentary (U2c).
A table of contents (U2c).
A small leaf (170 x 25 mm).
Description by Thillai Chidambaram Rajarethinam based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2019).

support.p: The leaves are larger in the middle of the bundle.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Civatarumōttaram: Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank. Broken into 2 fragments (fragment 1 and fragment 2). 400 x 30 mm.
1 folio = Civatarumōttaram: Invocation (satellite stanza). No foliation. 410 x 30 mm.
1 folio = Civatarumōttaram: Invocation (satellite stanzas and preface on the recto; commentary on the verso). Tamil foliation 1. 410 x 30 mm.
373 folios = Civatarumōttaram: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation 1‒373. 405/450 x 30/35 mm.
1 folio = Civatarumōttaram: Table of Contents. No foliation. Verso blank. 405 x 30 mm.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation despite boreholes. Broken leaves: U1, f1 + fragments ( left margin of U2c, f66, and right margin of another folio).

additions.desc: Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink and crossed-out in red ink: 463 (f[1]r).
Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink: 12 (f[1]r).
Invocation (āya kalaika) as satellite stanza, on its own independent unfoliated folio. Edited and translated by D'Avella (2020: 251-252). See details below.
Invocation (attimukattu) as satellite stanza, on an independent unfoliated folio. See details below.
Invocation (malaikkumakaḷ) as satellite stanza, on an independent unfoliated folio, followed by its commentary. See details below.
Left-marginal intertitles: ordinal number and chapter's name. See below.
12 final invocations as satellite stanzas (f372v1 to f373v3).
Total stanzas table (entitled civataṟmōttiram; 3 columns): chapter's name, preceded by its serial number and followed by its total stanzas (pāṭṭu); overall total stanzas (pāṭṭu). See details below.

binding.p: Original rosewood woodcovers. 410 x 30 x 15 mm.

origin.origDate: Dated to circa 1770 by Vinson (1868) and to 1770 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: This catalogue entry has been redacted by Thillai Chidambaram RAJARETHINAM (EFEO, Pondicherry) and encoded by Emmanuel FRANCIS (CNRS, CEIAS UMR 8564, EHESS/CNRS) for the research program Texts Surrounding Texts (TST, FRAL 2018, ANR/DFG). Version 1, July 2020.
Expanded by Charles LI upon conversion from EAD to TEI. Changed locus of U2c incipit to point to the correct folio.
Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 2, July 2022.
